p: Although CHIKV normally causes sporadic outbreaks, large epidemics have been documented. From 2004 to 2011, an epidemic that began in Kenya spread to India and Southeast Asia, affecting 1.4â€“6.5 million people [ 1]. In 2013, the virus initiated a large epidemic in the Western hemisphere, spreading extensively in the Caribbean and the Americas, with more than 1 million suspected cases [ 3].
